oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fairfield Baptist Church, 2001 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Fairfield Missionary Baptist Church located at 120 Fain Street in Nashville, Tennessee. Originally this church was called Fairfield Baptist Church. The building's foundation is comprised of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are brick. The roof is gabled and hipped, and made of tar shingles. The windows are colored glass and covered with plexi-glass. The doors are metal and glass. A two story brick addition is attached to the rear of the building. This added structure has a flat roof. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fairfield Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Fairfield Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
